intro: Atropis anisoclada, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive, cup-like shape. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has palmately divided leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated by insects. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
